The guidelines required to be developed and issued under subsection (a) shall include, at a
			 minimum, basic access to a covered dwelling unit and to not less than 1
			 level within such
			 covered dwelling unit, including—
an accessible entrance located on an accessible path from the public street or driveway;
accessible interior doors with sufficient clear width and accessible thresholds;
accessible environmental controls on the wall;

at least 1 accessible indoor room that has an area of not less than 70 square feet and contains
			 no side or dimension narrower than 7 feet;
an accessible bathroom with—
an accessible sink and toilet; and

reinforced walls that permit the
			 installation of grab bars; and
a kitchen space—
with accessible food preparation, washing, and storage areas; and

that can
			 easily be further adapted to accommodate an individual with a disability.
